subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In {{w|traditional Chinese}} (Taiwan, Hong Kong and Macau), this character is written with {{l|mul|干}} as the upper component, which is also the historical form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}.
* In {{w|simplified Chinese}}, (mainland China and Singapore), Japanese {{w|Kanji}}, Korean {{w|Hanja}} and Vietnamese {{w|History of writing in Vietnam|Nom script}}, this character is written with {{l|mul|千}} as the upper component.

subSections.title: Derived characters
subSections.text:
* [[Index:Chinese radical/舌]]

* {{l|mul|[[适]], [[敌]]}} <small>''({{w|Simplified Chinese|Simplified}} from the component <big>{{l|mul|啇}}</big>)''</small>
* {{l|mul|[[乱]], [[辞]]}} <small>''({{w|Simplified Chinese|Simplified}} from the component <big>{{l|mul|𤔔}}</big>)''</small>
